intro: Diplodium torquatum, commonly known as the twisted diplodium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that come in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique floral structure and vibrant colors make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Diplodium torquatum is also valued for its adaptability to arid environments.
